sentences.en: Along the length of the filter, the interference film like a wedge.
sentences.cn: 沿薄膜的长度方向看干涉膜尖劈.

sentences.en: Green and Pratt employed a rotating - mirror camera with an explosively driven wedge.
sentences.cn: Green和Pratt使用旋转镜头的摄影机,其具有一种爆发性的楔形物.

sentences.en: He had a banana and a wedge-shaped cheese for lunch.
sentences.cn: 他中饭吃一根香蕉和一块楔形的奶酪。

sentences.en: He hammered the wedge into the crack in the stone.
sentences.cn: 他用锤子把楔子砸入石缝里。

sentences.en: I started to feel Toby was driving a wedge between us.
sentences.cn: 我开始觉得托比在挑拨我们之间的关系。

sentences.en: I think it's the thin end of the wedge when you have armed police permanently on patrol round a city.
sentences.cn: 我觉得让武装警察永久性地在城市里巡逻是老鼠拉木锨，大头在后边。

sentences.en: It is also wedge - shaped to lenticular.
sentences.cn: 另外,它也呈楔 状 至透镜状.

sentences.en: Open the door wide and wedge it with a wad of newspaper.
sentences.cn: 把门开大,再用一卷报纸把它楔牢.

sentences.en: Put a wedge under the door so that it will stay open.
sentences.cn: 在门下面插个楔,好让门开着.

sentences.en: She couldn't wedge another item into the suitcase.
sentences.cn: 她再也无法把别的东西塞进箱子里去了.

sentences.en: The analysis of wedge failures is discussed in Chapter 8.
sentences.cn: 楔体破坏的分析将在第8章中讨论.

sentences.en: The box won't wedge into such a narrow space.
sentences.cn: 那盒无法塞进那么小的地方去.

sentences.en: the general aimed to drive a wedge between the city and its northern defences.
sentences.cn: 将军打算把该城和它北部的防御工事切断。

sentences.en: The phone was wedged under his chin.
The window doesn't stay closed unless you wedge it.
sentences.cn: 这扇窗户关不严,得用楔子上了.

sentences.en: Victoria wedged herself into the passenger seat.
sentences.cn: 维多利亚挤到了乘客座位上。

sentences.en: Wedge the plug into the hole.

words.tran_cn: 锲入（wedge的过去式和过去分词）
楔子；楔形物；导致分裂的东西

phrases.tran_cn: 光楔；光学劈片；光学梯尺
(非正式)可能引起大变化的小事

trans.tran_en: a piece of wood, metal etc that has one thick edge and one pointed edge and is used especially for keeping a door open or for splitting wood

trans.tran_cn: 把…楔住，把…楔牢，将…塞入，将…插入，将…挤入
trans.tran_en: to force something firmly into a narrow space
If you wedge something somewhere, you fit it there tightly
